tool_description: We have developed this API using machine learning algorithm with over 2 lakh training samples.
name: SentimentAPI
title: SentimentAPI

api_list.name: Sentiment Engine
api_list.url: https://sentimentapi.p.rapidapi.com/products/api/extractsentiment?text=Small portions. Expensive prices. Mediocre food. Beautiful new location in the Castro, perhaps good for a drink if you can find a seat over there. 3 stars for food, 2 stars for prices, 2 stars for friendly but mostly slow service.
api_list.description: Extracts sentiment from a given text. Result range from 1 to 5. While 1 represents the least sentiment and 5 represent the best sentiment. This version is implemented for English language only.

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.default: Small portions. Expensive prices. Mediocre food. Beautiful new location in the Castro, perhaps good for a drink if you can find a seat over there. 3 stars for food, 2 stars for prices, 2 stars for friendly but mostly slow service.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://sentimentapi.p.rapidapi.com/products/api/extractsentiment?text=Small portions. Expensive prices. Mediocre food. Beautiful new location in the Castro, perhaps good for a drink if you can find a seat over there. 3 stars for food, 2 stars for prices, 2 stars for friendly but mostly slow service."

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "sentimentapi.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://sentimentapi.p.rapidapi.com/products/api/extractsentiment?text={text}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "sentimentapi.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
